results.title: The Picture gallery
results.brief_description: Intrinsic in many great paintings is a sense of movement. Rather than seeming static, the figures appear to be caught in motion. A young Czech animator, Jan Trmal, has taken ten such paintings and by separating their elements has actually set them in motion for a brief time to the music of Gianfranco Maselli, Antonin Vranicky and Johann S. Bach.

results.title: The Picnic
results.brief_description: A small boy kept in after school finds a notice about a girls’ picnic and shows it to the boys who plan to gate crash. The girls realise this and prepare sandwiches with shoe nugget and drinks with paint. When the boys raid the lunch bags they receive a nasty shock.

results.title: The Physicists: playing dice with the universe
results.creator_credit: D Leiterman, Philip S. Hobel, Document Associates and Roger Hogen
results.brief_description: Describes the work of physicists as they experiment with ideas which few can comprehend. Tells how some are mapping the tiniest structures of matter, others are listening to the universe, hoping to discover intelligent life, and others are looking for black holes.

results.title: The Photographic vision
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description: This telecourse presents the technical principles of photography, the mechanics of the camera itself, the chemical and physical reactions which produce a permanent image and the use of various types of equipment and techniques to produce better quality photographs. The course explores the historical tradition in photography and the impact of the medium.

results.title: The Photographers
results.creator_credit: Christine Huneke, Time-Life Films and Jerry Sims
results.brief_description: Five of America’s top professional still photographers are seen here on assignments around the world. Includes Larry Burrows, Alfred Eisenstaedt, Mary Ellen Mark, John Dominis and Norman Parkinson.

results.title: The Photographer
results.brief_description: A whimsical sketch of a photographer in a small community, whose livelihood comes from understanding, and flattering, people’s vanities. As it presents a sampling of one day’s appointments, the film pokes gentle fun at the parade of human nature that passes before a photographer’s lens. Writen by Norman Klenman, photographed by Lorne C. Batchelor, narrated by William Hutt.

results.title: The Photographer
results.creator_credit: Affiliated Film Producers and Willard Van Dyke
results.brief_description: The life and work of the American photographer, Edward Weston. The artist is shown at work in California; shows the manner in which Mr Weston approaches his selection of material for pictorial composition and techniques he uses for developing the print. The film includes glimpses of the home of the artist and studies of the sea and mountain landscape of California. Commentary by Irving Jacoby. Narrated by Mel Brandt.
